title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire for Tuesday 8 September 2015 - BBC News
summary: northampton saints have signed south africa world cup winner victor matfield .
northampton town supporters ' trust is calling for answers over the future of the club .
news , sport , travel and weather updates resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage today
text: that 's all from us today on local live for northamptonshire .
we 'll be back with you tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .

documents.title: chris wilder says cobblers not affected by takeover talks
text: northampton town manager chris wilder has rubbished claims that what 's going on off the pitch has affected his teams performances on it .
cobblers have n't won in four league two games amid takeover talks .
players get paid , that 's the top and bottom of it they have to be big and strong enough to withhold that , especially the senior players . ''
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: david cardoza : 'i 'm open and honest '
text: chairman david cardoza has been speaking about social media campaign # wewantanswers organised by northampton town fans , which is demanding answers about the takeover of the club by an indian consortium and the development of the east stand .
there are legal bits of pieces which means i ca n't talk about it .
it is not protecting me , i wish i could talk more .
everyone knows i 'm open and honest . ''
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: victor matfield wants to win premiership and european rugby champions cup
text: south africa star and new northampton saints recruit victor matfield says it is `` an honour '' to join the club .

the world cup winner , who almost joined saints seven years ago , said : `` i have a genuine desire to hopefully play an instrumental role in a team effort , with the aim of lifting silverware in both the aviva premiership and the european rugby champions cup . ''
matfield will link up with the saints squad once his rugby world cup commitments with south africa have concluded .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton town chairman david cardoza : 'i 'll always tell people what 's happening if i can '
text: northampton town 's chairman david cardoza says he understands why fans are set to protest at the weekend .
the cobblers play oxford at sixfields on saturday , and the supporters ' trust plan to demonstrate against the current regime .
they say it 's after delays over current takeover talks , and a lack of communication .
anyone who knows me knows i will always tell people if i can .
there is stuff going on i ca n't tell you , but we are very close to the deal happening or not whatever the case may be ''
author: Joe Townsend
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: jim mallinder : matfield a 'force to be reckoned with '
text: northampton saints director of rugby jim mallinder says new signing victor matfield will bring a wealth of experience to franklin 's gardens .
he said : victor is one of the outstanding forwards in world rugby .
he has been at the top of the game for well over a decade now and his selection by south africa for a fourth consecutive world cup shows he remains a force to be reckoned with . ''
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: victor matfield a star of south african club rugby
text: new northampton saints signing victor matfield has been hugely successful as a club player in south africa .
he has been a blue bulls player in the currie cup for the best part of 15 years .
and while at the pretoria franchise he has lifted the super rugby title three times as captain , adding the same number of currie cups to his personal medal haul .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: saints sign springbok star matfield
text: northampton saints ' new signing victor matfield is widely regarded as one of the greatest second rows to have played the game .
the 38-year-old is south africa 's most capped player , having worn the famous green jersey 123 times heading into the 2015 rugby world cup - his fourth .
matfield was a key force in his country 's world cup winning campaign of 2007 - he was named man of the match in the 15-6 final win over england .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: breakingsaints sign south africa legend victor matfield
text: northampton saints have confirmed the signing of world cup winning springbok victor matfield ahead of the 2015/16 season .

documents.title: weather : cloudy , but dry
text: it 's staying mainly cloudy tonight , but aside from some patchy drizzle it will be dry .
under the cloud temps wo n't fall much lower than 11 or 12c .
on wednesday it '' ll be a cloudy start with occasional drizzle , but slowly turning brighter .
we should see a bit more sunshine by the afternoon .
highs of 19c ( 66f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: bid to improve saints match day parking
text: plans to improve parking on match days for northampton saints are being looked at by councillors .

northampton borough council is in talks with the club about ways to steward parking and council officers are looking at widening the use of the claret car park , free of charge , when the saints are playing at home .
tomorrow the council 's cabinet is looking at ways to alleviate problems faced by residents living near to the club 's grounds .
author: Nic Rigby
BBC News

documents.title: school in a warehouse leads to 're-think how to teach '
text: the head teacher of a new school in corby has admitted the unusual building has forced them to re-think how the children are taught .
the woodnewton learnspace annexe is based on the earlstrees industrial estate and occupies a converted warehouse .
below you can see a speed-up tour of the school which i recorded shortly before it opened to children .
it is a very open plan area , so i think some of what we will be doing is experimenting as we go along . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: first week for school in a warehouse
text: a new school , which has opened in corby , was built on an industrial estate in a former warehouse .
the learnspace building is an annexe to the existing woodnewton school in the town .
twenty-three children are starting this week and there 's a capacity of 90 .

head teacher , ellen wallace , said parents were initially reticent about sending their children to a school on an industrial estate , but their views have changed : `` what has been delightful to see is when parents come in through the gates and walk into the building , they 've really loved it . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton

documents.title: afternoon headlines : corby mps commons courts concerns northampton town supporters ' trust demand answers
text: the latest from our northampton newsroom
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers trust : 'culture where rumours spread '
text: more now on the statement from northampton town supporters ' trust demanding answers from the club over a proposed takeover by an indian consortium .
the statement adds : `` the lack of updates and answers from the chairman has created a culture where rumours begin to spread .
we feel that some of these rumours could also be addressed by the chairman , which would ease tensions if they were proved to be false . ''
the issues the # wewantanswers campaign want addressing relate to the takeover of the club , a borough council loan and progress on the redevelopment of the east stand .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: mp raises court concerns in commons
text: the government has insisted no decision has been made about the closure of corby magistrates ' court after warnings any change could deny people access to justice .
magistrates ' courts in corby and kettering , as well as kettering county court , are included on a list of dozens of courts and tribunals the ministry of justice is considering shutting down .
the government says its aim is that nobody should have to travel for more than an hour to reach court .

if corby magistrates ' court is closed , some of my constituents would have to drive for more than an hour to get to the nearest magistrates ' court many of those journeys would be impossible on public transport . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers supporters ' trust backs 'we want answers ' campaign
text: northampton town supporters ' trust is backing a social media campaign which has been demanding answers about the future of the club .
a statement on the trust 's website says : `` we appreciate and understand how difficult and frustrating a time this has been for the fans - and the trust board has shared that frustration . ''
ahead of the oxford united match at sixfields on saturday , fans will hold up 'question mark ' signs with the # wewantanswers slogan emblazoned on them .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: monument to 'surprisingly modern ' 18th century duke
text: we 've been talking about the montagu monuments at st edmunds church at warkton , near kettering .
the conservation work carried out on the sculptures was shortlisted for a national award .
the oldest of the monuments is to john , the 2nd duke of montagu , who lived at the nearby boughton house .

crispin powell , archivist to the duke of buccleuch , said john was surprisingly modern in his thinking for an 18th century duke : `` he was interested in the welfare of animals in an age when people were killing them .
`` he was an anti-racist at a time when we were still heavily involved in slavery , and he was religiously tolerant with a copy of the koran in his library . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: parent hits out at tresham decision to move course from kettering to corby
text: an angry parent has hit out after tresham college made the decision to move his daughter 's course from its kettering campus just days before term starts .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: mp tweets about closure of corby court
text: today , i raised local concerns about the closure of # corby magistrates ' court in the house of commons
are you concerned about all justice cuts , @ twitterid or only those which affect your electability ?
you were elected on a platform of public service cuts , @ twitterid but now ( claim to ) object to those on home turf .
all a bit shabby .

documents.title: judy carne : a bittersweet life
text: the actress judy carne , who has died aged 76 , was born joyce audrey botterill in 1939 .
she was brought up in kingsthorpe , northampton , where her parents ran a greengrocer 's shop .
in her 1985 autobiography , she described her life as `` bittersweet , '' confessing to several affairs and drug addiction .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: university of northampton nominated for national award
text: the university of northampton 's business school has been nominated for a national award..
it is on the shortlist for the times higher education awards .

mairi watson , deputy dean of the business school , says their work with local companies has stood them in good stead : `` one of our most notable successes this year is pairing students with local businesses .
that 's contributed to their employability once they 've left us . ''
the winners will be announced in november .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: judy carne 's 'tumultuous relationship ' with burt reynolds
text: judy carne , the northampton actress who has died aged 76 , was also known for her tumultuous relationship with actor burt reynolds .
to whom she was married from 1963-65 .
she detailed her relationship with reynolds in her 1985 autobiography 'laughing on the outside , crying on the inside : the bittersweet saga of the sock-it-to-me girl ' .
she wrote that when she and reynolds met they `` were immediately in love , so we immediately made love '' .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: appeal after car set alight in wellingborough
text: northamptonshire police are appealing for witnesses after a car was set alight on longfellow road in wellingborough last thursday .
the silver daihatsu charade was set alight at some point between 23:40 and 23:50 on 3 september .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton actress judy carne dies
text: judy carne - best known as the 'sock it to me ' girl in the 1960s television show rowen & martin 's laugh-in - has died aged 76 .
the northampton-born actress moved back to the county in the 1980s , where she was said to have lived a quiet life with her dogs in pitsford .
she had found overnight fame on the comedy sketch show and spent two years being doused with water every time she said the phrase `` sock it to me ! ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: headlines : corby people help refugees university up for national award
text: the latest news this lunchtime
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: disability payments 'a mess , ' says resource centre boss
text: the case of wellingborough woman , nikki pegram , who 's been told her disability payments will stop is a `` right mess '' according to a disability expert .
mrs pegram , who has a a rare form of amnesia , had received the personal independence payment but , when she reassessed , the department for work and pensions said she was no longer eligible .

mick dillon , chief executive of the disability resource centre , said : `` looking at the impact disability has and then trying to imagine what nikki is going through is hugely difficult for all of us '' .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton chronicle & echo : northamptonshire police buys 'most expensive ' batons and body armour vests
text: northamptonshire police paid the highest unit cost for batons and body armour vests of any force in england and wales , latest figures have shown .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: marble monuments dismantled 'like a jigsaw '
text: the experts who are conserving the montagu monuments say they had to take them apart like a three-dimensional jigsaw .
they date from the 18th and early 19th centuries and commemorate members of the montagu family from boughton house .
paul wooles , from skillington workshops , told me the monuments were in a poor state : `` what holds these monuments together is ironwork .
when that is combined with moisture , you get corrosion and the ironwork expands . ''
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: travel : accident on a5 at towcester
text: there 's been an accident on the a5 at towcester near the brackley road junction .
a shed load is causing delays .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: conservation work reaches finals of national award
text: conservation work carried out on four marble sculptures in a northamptonshire church reached the finals of a national award .
i was lucky enough to view the montagu monuments at st edmunds church in warkton , near kettering ; said to be some of the finest marble sculptures in the country .
skillington workshops , which carried out the conservation work , was nominated in the best craftsmanship category in the historic england angels awards .
they did not win but the conservators say they were pleased to get so far .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby collection points arranged to help refugees
text: one of the people behind the new corby stands for refugees facebook group is labour borough councillor , matt reay .
he said : `` we 're collecting essential supplies from clothing for men , women and children , to practical equipment like tents . ''
items can be dropped off at the shire horse pub willow brook road or at corby safe haven on dorking walk .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: fire and police launch rural response vehicle
text: fire and police services in northamptonshire have launched a new joint response vehicle to provide additional support to rural communities .
the rural intervention vehicle ( riv ) will operate in daventry and south northants .
it is staffed by a police and fire officer , and signals the second phase of a 12-month trial which began in east northamptonshire in 2014 .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby backs refugees with new facebook group
text: as mps prepare for an emergency debate on the migrant crisis , a facebook group , set up in corby to help refugees , has attracted over 700 'likes ' .
the corby stands with refugees group aims to collect items to send to refugees .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: northampton chronicle & echo : five resign at 'dysfunctional '
text: a village parish council in northamptonshire is in turmoil after five people resigned in a fortnight and an outgoing member labelled it dysfunctional '' .

documents.title: living with amnesia : woman 's disability payments stopped as she can walk and talk
text: we 've been talking about nikki pegram from wellingborough whose amnesia means she can only hold memories for 15 hours .
her partner , chris johnston , says she has been told her disability payments will stop as she has been deemed fit to work because she can walk 200m and talk to people .
in august , mr johnston told bbc radio northampton what it is like to live with amnesia .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: latest headlines : amnesia patient 's disability payments to stop corby backs help for refugees
text: this morning 's main stories
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: herald & post tweets moment vicar pulls out selfie stick during wedding
text: vicar pulls out selfie stick and takes snap during wedding at northants church -

documents.title: travel : a43 at brackley partially blocked
text: there 's been an accident between a petrol tanker , a van and a car on the a43/a422 in brackley .
the road is partially blocked and there is slow traffic on the brackley south roundabout .
travel has the latest details about northamptonshire 's roads .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: woman with amnesia 'to lose ' disability payments
text: a wellingborough woman who wakes up every morning thinking it is 15 october 2014 has been told her disability payments will stop .
nikki pegram had a number of long-term health conditions and was receiving the personal independence payment before she developed amnesia after falling on a metal pole outside kettering hospital .
the change in her health circumstances prompted a re-assessment and the department for work and pensions says she 's no longer eligible for help .
author: BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: travel : broken down lorry on a14
text: one lane is blocked and there are delays on the a14 westbound in kettering because of a broken down lorry .
the area affected is at j7 , a4300 .
the latest travel is on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: nine domestic abuse cases take place with children present every day
text: a report from northamptonshire 's safeguarding children board says there are nine cases a day of domestic abuse where children are present .
in the 12 months to april this year , northamptonshire police had recorded 3,362 such cases .
the safeguarding children 's board has a strategy for `` early help '' over the next five years , during which time it wants to get better at identifying young people who 're at risk .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: 'we want to put it right , ' says cobblers ' nicky adams
text: midfielder nicky adams says the northampton town squad are determined to make up for a disappointing couple of home games .
northampton town were beaten by dagenham at the weekend , their fourth game without a win in league two .
they 're down to 16th in the table .
adams said : `` we do work hard .
we just need to cut them errors out .
we 're a good set of lads and we want to put it right . ''
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: travel : congestion between b4035 and a361 near banbury
text: there is queuing traffic on queensway in both directions in banbury .
the congestion is between the b4035 broughton road junction and the a361 bloxham road junction .
the latest can be found on bbc travel .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: latest headlines : police deal with nine domestic abuse cases a day
text: this is what we 're talking about :
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: weather : dry with sunny spells
text: it 'll be a dry day with some bright or sunny spells in most places .
the wind will be mainly light and variable .
today 's maximum temperature : 16c ( 61f ) .
watch the full forecast with kate kinsella on the bbc look east page .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live feed for northamptonshire
text: welcome to local live for northamptonshire on tuesday , 8 september .
between now and 18:00 , my colleagues and i will be updating this page with the latest news , sport , weather and travel for the county .
you can email us or contact us via twitter or facebook .
author: Martin Borley
BBC Northampton
